Description: Bronze lamp: elongated body and long, fluked nozzle with a rounded tip. Circular wick-hole. Flat, sunken top, with a raised edge and a flat rim around the body and the nozzle. Filling-hole of ivy-leaf shape, with an engraved stem. At the rear is a handle with a stem, now distorted, of angular D-shaped section, curving forward to a serrated collar, from which emerges a horse's head and neck. Raised base-ring, with 'lathe-turned' mouldings at its centre. Surface colouration: cleaned to bare metal.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), 192-23-32 In an X group tomb of 4th-6th cent AD
Curator's comments: Close and near: Valenza Mele, N., 1981. ‘Catalogo delle lucerne in bronzo : Museo nazionale archeologico di Napoli’. Rome : Istituto poligrafico e Zecca dello stato, 241-2, both from Pompeii; 'Palestine Exploration Fund Annual' 5, 1929, p. 97, fig. 20, from the Tyropoeon Valley, Jerusalem, in the 'Lower Byzantine Level'; Sotheby New York 'Sale Catalogue' 29 November 1989, Lot 97; Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore, Inv. No. 1683; Neugebauer, K.A., 1938. ‘Antiken in deutschem Privatbesitz : Festschrift zum fünfundzwanzigjährigen Bestehen der Vereinigung’. Berlin : Gebr. Mann, No. 74, 'from Trapezos in Pontus'; Esperandieu, E., and Rolland, H., 1959. ‘Bronzes antiques de la Seine-Maritime’. Paris : Éditions du Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique, No. 187, from Port Jerome; Sotheby 'Sale Catalogue' 19 May 1986, Lot 183; ibid., 12 December 1988, Lot 115; Loeschcke, S., 1911. ‘Beschreibung römischer Altertümer, gesammelt von Carl Anton Niessen’. Cologne, 3778. For similar horse-head-handled lamps in fired clay, see K. Goethert in 'Trierer Zeitschrift' 54, 1991, pp. 217-29: most are dated to the first half of the second century AD; also Loeschcke, S., 1911. ‘Beschreibung römischer Altertümer, gesammelt von Carl Anton Niessen’. Cologne, 2107, from Cologne, and 3778; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 322-3; Egyptian Archaeology 1991, Vol.I p.18; Illustrated London News 20 October 1962 p.607, fig.17; Illustrated London News 7 July 1962, p.34.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3672)
Bacon 1971 / Archaeology : Discoveries in the 1960's (pp.226-7, fig.79)
Wenig 1978 / Africa in antiquity: the arts of Ancient Nubia and the Sudan (p.318, no.280)
Mills 1982 / The cemetaries of Qaṣr Ibrîm : a report of the excavations conducted by W.B. Emery in 1961 (pl.LXXXVI, 4)
James 1982 / Excavating in Egypt : The Egypt Exploration Society (p.134, fig.61)
Davies 1991 / Egypt and Africa: Nubia from Prehistory to Islam (p.316) (mentioned)
Curtis & Tallis 2012 / The Horse from Arabia to Ascot (186)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 24 May-30 Sep, London, BM 'The horse:from Arabia to Royal Ascot' 2010 01 Jun-31 Dec, USA, Kentucky Horse Park, International Museum of the Horse, 'A Gift from the Desert'
Condition: good (repaired). Surface coloration: cleaned to bare metal.
